info.name: Cranial fossa, posterior
info.description: The posterior cranial fossa is the largest and deepest of the three cranial fossae.  The cerebellum, pons and medulla are contained within the posterior fossa.  The tentorium cerebelli forms the roof of the fossa so that communication between the middle and posterior fossae is through the incisure or notch of the tentorium.  The midbrain lies within the tentorial notch.
